sect1.title: Simulation Launcher
sect1.para: To quickly launch the simulation, just select tictoc.exe and open the run dialog as shown in the screen shot.
In the Run Dialog that appears, just select tictoc and select TictocTest configuration to be launched. Then simply press Run to see your experiment in action.
Your experiment will be launched in the Tkenv environment, and you should see information being exchanged between the two nodes, if you press “play” to start the experiment.

This section was meant to give you a glimpse of how quickly you can put together a working experiment, despite the power and complexity of the system. Now let us examine the editor’s features in more detail.
Just as in the NED Editor, the Ini File Editor is also capable of quickly jumping to the definition of parameters.
For example, Control-Clicking Tictoc6.toc.delayTime in the omnetpp.ini of the tictoc samples,
Results in tictocned6.ned being opened, and the cursor positioned to the line where delayTime is defined.
This feature helps in quickly understanding what that particular item’s intended function is, and where it is defined, potentially saving a lot of time.
